tables.table_title: Notations applied in the model of BFSP_SDST.
rows: The set of jobs, i.e., $J=\left\{J_{1}, J_{2}, \ldots, J_{n}\right\}$.
The set of machines, i.e., $M=\left\{M_{1}, M_{2}, \ldots, M_{m}\right\}$.
The processing order of jobs, i.e., $\boldsymbol{\pi}=\{e(1), e(2), \ldots, e(n)\}$. $x(i)$ is a dummy job.
The set of all feasible schedules.
The operation corresponding to processing of job $J_{i}$ on machine $M_{j}$.
The processing time of operation $O_{e(i), j}$.
The setup time between two consecutive jobs $x(i-1)$ and $x(i)$ on machine $M_{j} . S_{e(i), e(i), j}$ is the initial setup time of job $x(i)$.
The departure time of job $x(i)$ on machine $M_{j}$. $d_{e(i), 0}$ is the start time of job $x(i)$ on machine $M_{j}$.
The duration time between the starting time of $x(i)$ on $M_{j}$ and the starting time of the last job on the same machine.
The makespan of a sequence or schedule $\boldsymbol{\pi}$.

tables.table_title: Processing and setup times of an example of BFSP_SDST.
The level of each parameter for MCEDA.
Results of ANOVA for MCEDA`s parameters.
Comparison results of MCEDA with its six variants.
Parameters of the compared algorithms for BFSP_SDST.
rows: $\begin{aligned} & T_{\text {frad }}=\sum_{s=1}^{n} \sum_{j=1}^{n} p_{s j} / 5 \mathrm{~mm}, T_{\text {frad }}=1, N_{\text {opt }}=100000, \\ & \alpha=0.8, \beta=\left(T_{\text {frad }}-T_{\text {frad }}\right) /\left(\left(N_{\text {opt }}-1\right) \times T_{\text {frad }}+T_{\text {frad }}\right), \end{aligned}$

$\begin{aligned} & T_{0}=0.6 \times \sum_{s=1}^{n} \sum_{j=1}^{n} p_{s j} / 10 \mathrm{~m}, D_{\text {threshold }}=5, G_{T}=4000, \\ & n_{c}=6, \alpha=0.97, \text { Max } T=60 \mathrm{~mm} . \\ & \alpha=0.75, \beta=0.5, d=8 . \end{aligned}$

$\begin{aligned} & T_{\text {frad }}=\sum_{s=1}^{n} \sum_{j=1}^{n} p_{s j} / 5 \mathrm{~mm}, T_{\text {frad }}=0.1 \times T_{\text {frad }}, k_{\max }=100000, \\ & \beta=\left(T_{\text {frad }}-T_{\text {frad }}\right) /\left(\left(N_{\text {opt }}-1\right) \times T_{\text {frad }}+T_{\text {frad }}\right), \end{aligned}$
popsize $=20, \varphi=0.75, p l s=0.6, T=5, T i m e_{\max }=60 \mathrm{~mm}$.
$\begin{aligned} & \text { popsize }=50, \lambda=0.3, t=60 \mathrm{~mm} . \\ & \text { popsize }=50, P_{c}=0.1, P_{t 0}=0.005, G_{t}=25 . \end{aligned}$
$\begin{aligned} & \tau_{\mathrm{p}}=1 / M_{\max } \rho=0.75 . \\ & \text { Temperature }=T \times \sum_{s=1}^{n} \sum_{j=1}^{n} p_{s j} / 10 \mathrm{~mm}, T=0.5, d=4 . \end{aligned}$
